content:
This father is always present when you’re with him, and you can feel how he’s there for you and with you.
You can always feel safe with this father, and he never does anything to frighten you.
He is a responsible father, and you can feel that he takes care of things in a dependable way.
When you’re with this father, things are clear and predictable, and you feel that he’s in control.
This father has attuned playfulness, and you can feel how he’s with you in a way that is enjoyable and fun, but also aware of your feelings and needs.

In this way, the therapist is using the information from the patient’s AAI to shape the imagery and suggest specific qualities of the imagined parent figures that are the positive opposites of the problematic aspects of the patient’s actual experiences with his or her parents. This helps to create new, secure attachment representations and facilitate the process of earned attachment security.
